results.firPara: The team from the Negev desert, who will play Celtic in the Champions League play-off, were never expected to win their domestic competition and it was the most emotional of victories for lifelong supporter Shaul Adar
results.secPara: The following is an extract from issue 22 of the Blizzard, which is on sale in September. The Blizzard is a quarterly football journal available from www.theblizzard.co.uk on a pay-what-you-like basis in print and digital formats.
results.webTitle: Hapoel Beer Sheva’s Israeli title win: season of darkness, season of light

results.firPara: With the new football season well underway, wed like you to document your season supporting your club

results.webTitle: The stories of your season: share your football club photos and memories

results.firPara: Liverpool have rejected Crystal Palaces latest bid for Christian Benteke, worth an initial £23m with a further £7m due in add-ons, with frustration steadily mounting on all sides of what have proved protracted negotiations.
results.secPara: Palace made contact with the Merseyside club once again on Monday and subsequently tabled an offer which, in principle, matched Liverpools valuation of the Belgium international forward.
results.webTitle: Liverpool reject Crystal Palace’s latest bid for Christian Benteke

results.firPara: A top-flight match in Sweden had to be abandoned when the goalkeeper for Ostersund was attacked by a masked intruder.
results.secPara: Aly Keita was knocked to the ground by the unidentified man who was bundled away by players and stewards while the goalkeeper was given medical attention.
results.webTitle: Swedish match abandoned after masked intruder attacks Ostersund goalkeeper

results.firPara: Burnley have announced the signing of the Belgium midfielder Steven Defour from Anderlecht for £7.5m.
results.secPara: The 28-year-old has agreed a three-year deal and becomes the Clarets fourth signing of the summer.
results.webTitle: Burnley sign midfielder Steven Defour from Anderlecht for £7.5m

results.firPara: Todays gossip always wanted to be a Tenenbaum
results.secPara: Todays gossip always wanted to be a Tenenbaum
results.webTitle: Football transfer rumours: Cesc Fàbregas heading to Real Madrid?

results.firPara: Watford are close to signing Roberto Pereyra from Juventus in a £10.4m deal that could rise to £13m.
results.secPara: The Watford owners, the Pozzo family, know the Argentinian well from his time at Udinese and have reached an agreement with Juve to sign the player, who is now in talks with the Premier League club over his terms.
results.webTitle: Watford close to £13m signing of Roberto Pereyra from Juventus

results.firPara: • Manager believes Chelsea match-winner should have got two yellow cards
results.secPara: Slaven Bilic and his West Ham United players were left bemoaning the reluctance of the referee to dismiss Diego Costa for two bookable offences as the Spain forward scored the late goal that ensured Antonio Contes tenure as Chelsea manager began with a morale-boosting win.
results.webTitle: West Ham’s Slaven Bilic ‘not happy’ Costa escaped red before late winner

results.firPara: Stamford Bridges new manager shows total absorption in the 2-1 win over West Ham, punctuated by yells of frustration in Italian at missed chances
results.secPara: Stamford Bridges new manager shows total absorption in the 2-1 win over West Ham, punctuated by yells of frustration in Italian at missed chances
results.webTitle: Antonio Conte steps into the Chelsea spotlight but Mourinho shadow remains | Amy Lawrence

results.firPara: Diego Costa, who was fortunate not to be sent off, scored a late winner to give Antonio Conte the perfect start to life as Chelseas manager
results.secPara: Diego Costa, who was fortunate not to be sent off, scored a late winner to give Antonio Conte the perfect start to life as Chelseas manager
